page.title: 13Industry_final
page.content: Without the backwashing process the filter beds would rapidly clog and be of no use.The dirty water from this process is carried into an outside settling tank from where, every five months,fifty thousand gallons of sludge are removed. As alum is an acid it reduces the pH of the water to 6.2 which is unacceptably low.It is necessary therefore to introduce a hydrated lime powder after the filtration process which brings the pH back up to the correct level of 8.The water is now ready to be pumped into the public water supply system.
